title: Upgrading App (Retaining Feature Access/Settings)
custom_preconds:
Given the user has the current Store build version installed from HockeyApp
And the user has logged in with an entitled account
And the user has set Favorite Team(s)
custom_steps:
When the user overwrites the app with the latest Test Debug Build
And launches the app
custom_expected:
Then the user's login information will be retained
And the user's feature access will be retained
And the user's Favorite Teams will be retained

title: Video Launch Points
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed the app
and navigate to the areas of the app where video highlights are available
custom_steps: When the user attempts to play video from the following sections:

custom_steps_separated.content: Team Page carousel (handset only)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the highlight opens in Full Screen mode
And the highlight can be watched in it's entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Team Page video index (handset only)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And rotating to Landscape will play the highlight in Full screen mode
And the highlight can be watched in it's entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Videos section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And rotating to Landscape will play the highlight in Full screen mode
And the highlight can be watched in it's entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: News Article
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And rotating to Landscape will play the highlight in Full screen mode
And the highlight can be watched in it's entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Video token from a News Article
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And rotating to Landscape will play the highlight in Full screen mode
And the highlight can be watched in it's entirety

title: MiLB.tv - Switching Feeds
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an iPhone and iPad (check both)
and is a MiLB.TV Premium user
custom_steps:
When a user is watching an MiLB.TV video
and has the OOTSB overlay displayed and the user taps on the other feed of the game
custom_expected:
Then the Media Framework check appears
and the user is let into the other feed

title: 10 AM Scoreboard Flip
custom_preconds: Given the user is on an iOS device with First Pitch
custom_steps:
When the user opens First Pitch
and taps on Scoreboard

custom_steps_separated.content: when the device date is the current date before 10am
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Scoreboard will show the previous day's games

custom_steps_separated.content: when the device date is the current date after 10am
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Scoreboard will show the current day's games

title: Data Updates
custom_preconds: Given a user has First Pitch installed
custom_steps:
When a user is observing a live game
or a strung game in QA
custom_expected: Then the following data will update accordingly:

custom_steps_separated.content: iPhone on the Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Inning including States, Linescore including RHE, Count, Outs, Basepaths

custom_steps_separated.content: iPad on the Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Inning, Linescore including RHE, Count, Outs, Basepaths

custom_steps_separated.content: iPhone Scoreboard (collapsed)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Inning, Score, Count, Outs, Basepaths

custom_steps_separated.content: iPhone Scoreboard (expanded)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Inning, Linescore including RHE, Count, Outs, Basepaths, Pitcher, Batter

custom_steps_separated.content: iPad Scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Inning, RHE, Count, Outs, Basepaths, Pitcher, Batter

title: Gameday - Switching Games
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is in Gameday
and switches between games in the OOTSB (iPad)
or switches between games on the Scoreboard (iPad/iPhone)

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a game in preview and another game in preview
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Game Preview view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a game in preview and another game in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Live game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a game in preview and another game in final
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Wrao game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a live game and a game in preview
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Game Preview and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a live game and another live game
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Live game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a live game and game in final
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Wrap game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a final game and a game in preview
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Game Preview and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a final game and a game in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Live game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches final game and a game in final
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Wrap game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

title: General App UX
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed on an iPad and iPhone

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is swiping between games on the Team Page Schedule/Scores module
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then it is smooth and no blinking and all data loads

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is swiping vertically on the Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then it is smooth and no blinking and all data loads

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is swiping between games on the Scoreboard (collapsed)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then it is smooth and no blinking and all data loads

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is swiping between games on the Scoreboard (expanded)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then it is smooth and no blinking and all data loads

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is swiping vertically on the news index
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then it is smooth and no blinking and all data loads

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is swiping between news articles
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then it is smooth and no blinking and all data loads
